com.jgaap.gui.guiComponents
Class guiPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.jgaap.gui.guiComponents.guiPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class guiPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Simple class that extends JPanel and represents a single step of a multi-step process.

Author:
Chuck Liddell
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID
See Also:
Constant Field Values

stepName

public final java.lang.String stepName
Represents the name of the step this panel represents. This name will be displayed in the GUI's step progress indicator, and will also be used to identify to classes implementing StepListener which step is ready for execution. Once set, the stepName cannot be changed.

nextButtonText

private java.lang.String nextButtonText
nextButtonText allows programmers to override the default text that will be displayed on the 'Next' button in the step GUI.

stepListeners

private java.util.Vector<StepListener> stepListeners
Vector of objects that implement StepListener and are waiting for this panel to trigger execute events.

Constructor Detail

guiPanel

public guiPanel(java.lang.String stepName)
Basic constructor. Creates a new guiPanel with a double buffer and a flow layout.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents

guiPanel

public guiPanel(java.lang.String stepName,
                boolean isDoubleBuffered)
Creates a new guiPanel with FlowLayout and the specified buffering strategy.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents
isDoubleBuffered - flag indicating this panel's buffering strategy

guiPanel

public guiPanel(java.lang.String stepName,
                java.awt.LayoutManager layout)
Create a new buffered guiPanel with the specified layout manager.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents
layout - a specific LayoutManager to override the default

guiPanel

public guiPanel(java.lang.String stepName,
                java.awt.LayoutManager layout,
                boolean isDoubleBuffered)
Creates a new guiPanel with the specified layout manager and buffering strategy.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents
layout - a specific LayoutManager to override the default
isDoubleBuffered - flag indicating this panel's buffering strategy
Method Detail

addStepListener

public void addStepListener(StepListener listener)
Add a StepListener to this panel, which will receive notification of any calls this panel gets to execute.

Parameters:
listener - the StepListener to be added to this step panel.

executeStep

public void executeStep()
Tell this step panel, and any StepListeners it has, to execute.

getNextButtonText

public java.lang.String getNextButtonText()
Get the text that should be displayed on the 'Next' button.

Returns:
String containing the text to overlay on the 'Next' button

setNextButtonText

public void setNextButtonText(java.lang.String newText)
Change the text that is displayed on the 'Next' button in the step GUI.

Parameters:
newText - the new text to be displayed on the button
